text: 何をしたんだ、捜査! / 信号、受信を確認! / 感染システム切り替え完了 / 全神経、ナビシステムへ直結完了
translation: What did you do?! Signal reception confirmed! Infection system switch complete. All neural connections directly linked to the navigation system.
grammar: 完了 (kanryō) is used at the end of statements to indicate 'complete' - common in technical/military communications.

text: 感情阻止の32.8%が不鮮明、モニターできません / 構わん / システム開放 砲撃開始
translation: 32.8% of emotional blocking is unclear, we can't monitor it. It doesn't matter. System release. Commence attack.
grammar: 構わん (kamawan) is a rough/masculine contraction of 構わない meaning 'I don't care' or 'it doesn't matter'.

text: これがダミープラグの力なの? / システム成長 / さらにゲインが上がります
translation: Is this the power of the dummy plug? System growth. The gain is increasing further.
grammar: なの at the end is a feminine question marker, softer than のか. Common in female speech.

text: 泊まれ 泊まれ泊まれ 泊まれ泊まれ
translation: Stop! Stop, stop! Stop, stop!
grammar: 止まれ is the imperative form of 止まる (to stop). The imperative is formed by changing the final -u to -e for godan verbs.

text: やめろ!
translation: Stop it!
grammar: やめろ is the rough imperative of やめる (to stop/quit). For ichidan verbs, drop -る and add -ろ.

text: やめろ!
translation: Stop it!

vocabulary.meaning: to stop, to quit, to give up

grammar: Repetition of やめろ shows desperation and urgency in the speaker's plea.

text: エ・エバー3号機 / あ、いえ、目標は完全に沈黙しました
translation: E-Eva Unit 03... Ah, no, the target has gone completely silent.
grammar: しました is the polite past form of する. The speaker corrects themselves from saying 'Eva' to 'target' - showing the emotional weight of the situation.

text: これにしよった / こだまお姉ちゃんとのぞみと私 / 4人分か
translation: I'll go with this one. Kodama, Nozomi, and me. So for four people, huh.
grammar: にする means 'to decide on' something. ～人分 is a counter for portions/servings per person.

text: 明日は食べてくれるかな / こっちにもいたぞ / 生存者だ / 行きは / 非常に空洞させてくれ
translation: I wonder if he'll eat tomorrow... There's someone here too! A survivor! Quick, make emergency space!
grammar: ～てくれるかな expresses wondering/hoping someone will do something for you. かな adds uncertainty.

text: 生きてる
translation: He's alive.
grammar: 生きてる is a contraction of 生きている - the -te iru form indicating a continuing state.

text: おかしい / よかったな / 桂木
translation: Strange... That's good. Katsuragi.
grammar: よかったな uses な as a masculine sentence-ending particle expressing emotion or seeking agreement.

text: いつかは
translation: Someday...
grammar: いつかは emphasizes 'someday' with は adding contrast or emphasis, suggesting determination about the future.

text: 心配ない / 君よりは軽傷だ
translation: Don't worry. Her injuries are lighter than yours.
grammar: より is a comparative particle meaning 'than'. 君よりは = 'compared to you' / 'than you'.

text: そう / エヴァ3号機は / 使徒として処理されたそうだ 正気に
translation: I see. Eva Unit 03 was reportedly disposed of as an Angel. Officially.
grammar: ～そうだ (hearsay) indicates reported information - 'I heard that...' or 'reportedly'.

text: 私 私 シンジ君に何も話してない
translation: I... I haven't told Shinji anything.
grammar: 何も + negative verb = 'nothing at all'. 話してない is casual contraction of 話していない.

text: シンジ君 / ミサトさん / 無事だったんですね
translation: Shinji! Misato-san! So you're safe.
grammar: ～んですね expresses realization or confirmation of something. The ん (short for の) adds explanation/emphasis.

text: 私はね、ごめんなさい。
translation: I... I'm sorry.
grammar: ね after 私は softens the statement and creates an emotional pause before the apology.

text: 私はあなたに大事なことを伝えなきゃいけなかったのに、こんなことに。
translation: I had to tell you something important, but it came to this.

vocabulary.meaning: to convey, to tell, to communicate

grammar: ～なきゃいけなかった is casual form of ～なければいけなかった meaning 'had to do'. のに at the end expresses regret - 'even though I should have'.

text: リストさん、僕は、僕は人を、父さんがやめてってたのなのに。
translation: Misato-san, I... I [hurt] a person, even though Father kept telling me to stop.
grammar: やめてって is casual contraction of やめてくれと言って - 'told me to stop'. のに expresses 'even though'.

text: シンジック、ごめんね、ごめんね。 / エントリープラグ回収班より連絡。パイロットの生存を確認。 / 生きてた。 / あの、3号機のパイロットは
translation: Shinji, I'm sorry, I'm sorry. Message from the entry plug recovery team. Pilot survival confirmed. He's alive. Um, the Unit 03 pilot is...
grammar: ～より is a formal way to say 'from' in official communications. 生きてた is casual past of 生きている.

text: NCLの変質サンプルは最優先で / オースチルドレンは
translation: The LCL altered sample is top priority. The Fourth Children is...
grammar: 最 (sai) prefix means 'most' or 'highest'. 最優先で = 'with top priority'.

text: 当時 / シンジ君 / シンジ君 / シンジ君 / シンジ君 / シンジ君
translation: Touji... Shinji! Shinji! Shinji! Shinji! Shinji!
grammar: 君 (kun) is a suffix typically used for boys/young men, showing familiarity. Repetition shows desperate calling.

text: シンジはついに自らの意思でエヴァーを降りる / だが彼に関係なく信仰する最強の人が次の惨劇を生むのだった
translation: Shinji finally decides to leave Eva by his own will. But regardless of him, the strongest one advancing will give birth to the next tragedy.
grammar: のだった is a narrative past tense used in storytelling, adding dramatic emphasis to the outcome.

text: 次回男の戦い
translation: Next time: A Man's Battle
grammar: 次回 is commonly used in anime/TV to introduce the next episode title.

text: Редактор субтитров А.Семкин Корректор А.Егорова
translation: (Russian credits: Subtitle editor A. Semkin, Proofreader A. Egorova)
grammar: This is Russian text (credits), not Japanese. It appears to be from a fan-subbed version.
